Instrument.name: Viking Lander 2 Spacecraft Seismometer
Instrument.description: The Viking Lander 2 Spacecraft (VL2) seismometer, part of NASA's Viking mission to Mars, was designed to measure seismic activity and detect any potential Marsquakes. Unfortunately, due to its placement on the top of the lander, the data were heavily contaminated by wind noise, making it primarily useful as a weather station, detecting wind speeds rather than major seismic events. Despite this, it operated for over 500 Martian solar days (sols) and provided valuable information about the low seismic activity on Mars.
